Name: Safe Harbor
Description: Safe Harbor serves women, children, and men and provides many services; shelter, crisis line, support groups, rape/assault task force, resources, community and public education, food pantry, assistance with protection order paperwork, and a Kids Konnection Visitation and Exchange Center.

Name: Salvation Army - Aberdeen
Description: Provides assistance with food, clothing, utilities, prescriptions, rent and other needs as interview may bring out Provide spiritual support and counseling Provide a noon luncheon, holiday meals, and after school programming for youth.

Name: Baltic Food Bank
Description: This food bank is available twice monthly. Once on a Wednesday in the evening and last on a Saturday in the morning The easiest way to revive food is to just call the number leave a message and they will return your call  to setup a time that  works for you.they have a variety of pantry items but will also give you a Voucher for the store to get milk meat fruits and veggies.

Name: Beresford Faith in Action/Food Pantry
Description:
Beresford Faith in Action serves clients in need of food, utility and rent assistance in the city of Beresford as well as those living in Union or Lincoln County. Also, Faith in Action provides funding for the Beresford Backpack food program during the school year and networks clients with other resources or organizations in the area that can help them.

Name: Marshall County Food Pantry
Description: Marshall County Food Pantry supports those in need in Marshall County, South Dakota, including the communities of Britton, Veblen, Langford, Lake City, and Eden.  The food pantry is open every Friday and Saturday morning from 10 a.m. to noon.

Name: Brookings County Food Pantry
Description:
Brookings Food Pantry Mission:  The primary objects and purposes of the Brookings County Food Pantry shall be to help solve EMERGENCY food needs of Brookings County families by providing them with surplus or salvaged food, for the benefit of the general public and to relieve the public burden.
 
To receive emergency food assistance please bring the following with you:
1. Proof

Name: Ascension Lutheran Church
Description: MEALS ON WHEELSAscension serves Meals on Wheels/60+ Dining from May 26-June 5.  For more information please call.

Name: Richard R. Burgess Food Bank of First Baptist Church
Description: We provide services the N.W. Iowa,S.E. South Dakota,and S.E. Minnesota.  We are Available 24/7 by telephone.  We ask that you come to the Church office during Business hours.Office Hours  Monday - Friday8:30am to 4:30pmSaturday8:30am - 12:00pmAfter hours please call.

Name: Castlewood Food Pantry
Description:
*Hours are 2-4 p.m. the 1st and 3rd Sunday and 4-6 p.m. the 1st and 3rd Wednesday of each month.
*Must be a resident of the Castlewood School District.  1-2 people in a family = 1 bag of groceries for a total of 2 bags per month.
*3-5 people in a family = 2 bags of groceries for a total of 4 bags per month.  Diapers = one unit twice a month.  Coupon = up to two a month.

Name: Clark County Inter-lakes Community Action Partnership
Description:
Commodity Supply Food-Depending upon availability, commodities from the US Dept. of Ag surplus stocks are provided to non-profit charitable institutions that regularly serve meals to needy persons.  In addition to surplus food, Congress appropriates money to purchase food for soup kitchens and food banks.

Name: Miner County Office - Inter-Lakes Community Action Partnership
Description: ICAP is a federally designated Community Action Program providing self-sufficiency services to low-income and elderly persons in Brookings, Clark, Codington, Deuel, Grant, Hamlin, Kingsbury, Lake, Lincoln, McCook, Miner, Minnehaha, Moody, and Turner counties in eastern and central South Dakota Major service components include Early Child Development (Head Start, Early Head Start), Nutrition, Housi

Name: Salvation Army - Huron
Description: The Salvation Army is a non-profit organization that helps the needy We have a daily Genesis Feeding Program that serves lunch from 11:30am -12:30pm, Monday - Friday for a nominal fee of a $1.00 Provides food and clothing on a emergency basis. The food pantry gives baskets of food from 1:00pm - 3:30pm, Monday - Friday to those who are eligible.

Name: Helping Hands - Huron
Description: Offer clothing closet, food pantry, and thrift store. For more information, please call.

Name: Rural Office Community Services, Inc
Description: Provides one month's assistance with food, utilities, emergency lodging and rent on an emergency basis for individuals and families facing a hardship and are unable to be assisted from other immediate direct resources Also works closely with 12 food pantries to assist persons with emergency food needs.

Name: Native American Women's Health Ed. Resource Center
Description: The programs offered by this agency includes community organizing and leadership development; a domestic violence program and shelter (Women's Lodge); an AIDS prevention program; a child development program; an adult learning program; environmental issues; transitional housing; cancer prevention; fetal alcohol syndrome awareness program; a clearinghouse of health educational materials; a food pan
